headline: Double Layer Pumpkin Cheesecake
description: Pumpkin cheesecake with a twist! Two cheesecake layers (plain and spiced pumpkin) team up to deliver fantastic fall flavor in this easy holiday dessert.

video.description: See how to make this rich cheesecake, a great alternative to pumpkin pie.
video.name: Double Layer Pumpkin Cheesecake

name: Double Layer Pumpkin Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch ground cloves, or more to taste
1 pinch ground nutmeg, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Make cheesecake layer: Beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add eggs, one at a time, blending well after each addition.
Spread 1 cup batter in the graham cracker crust.
Make pumpkin layer: Add pumpkin puree, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg to the remaining batter; stir gently until well blended.
Carefully spread on top of plain cheesecake batter in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are puffed and the surface is firm except for a small spot in the center that jiggled when the pan is gently shaken, 35 to 40 minutes.
Remove from the oven, set on a wire rack, and cool to room temperature, 1 to 2 hours.
Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving, preferably overnight.

review.reviewBody: I can not get enough of this cheesecake! I share with my friends and was told it was decadent. I do add just a little bit of pumpkin pie spice. I make my own graham cracker crust and whipped cream. Everyone that I've shared with absolutely love it. I make this pie all the time now because we can't live without it! Best pie ever.
Followed exactly how it’s printed, delicious. Had to make another one. This will be a must every year next to the buttermilk pie.

I've never made a cheesecake before, and I will say that this recipe was easy & delicious! I love pumpkin everything ,and this was the perfect amount of pumpkin and cheesecake flavor! It was a Thanksgiving hit. Even my husband who isn't even a fan of pumpkin really enjoyed this! Will make again!
My family’s new favorite Thanksgiving dessert. Even members that don’t care for plain cheesecake or pumpkin pie loved it.

This is visually beautiful but didn't have much taste. I'd make it again, but I'd probably double the spice in the pumpkin layer and maybe add some molasses or ginger to the graham cracker crust I make.

Ok taste, but probably would benefit from a little (1/4 tsp) salt. Biggest concern is that it was too much filling for my store-bought 9” pie crust. Next time I will adjust the filling and use a 10” pan

This is requested EVERY Thanksgiving, at home and at work. My boss, who doesn't even like sweets/dessert, LOVES this pumpkin cheesecake is so excited when I make it. I follow the recipe as written and double it, to get a thicker cake with more height. This is a MUST try and staple to have in your recipe box!

The taste is great! However, the way the recipe is written creates a cheesecake that is less than an inch tall including the crust. The given recipe would be better in a 6 or 7 inch pan but Not in a 9 inch. I doubled the ingredients and used a water bath in a 9 inch and it was perfect.

This is an easy desert to prepare. My family are cheesecake and pumpkin pie fans, so this satisfies their cravings well. I do add at least a 1/2 can of pumpkin, sometimes more. I also add lots more cinnamon cloves and nutmeg as I found the first time I made it, the flavor was lacking. I don't measure the spices, but I guesstimate is is about 3x's the amount listed in the recipe. I also refrigerate overnight to let the flavors meld together. Top with some whipped cream and you are ready to go!
I make it every year, no changes. I love it and my family, coworkers, and friends love it too!
I loved it, and so did my family! So good!

I do not like pumpkin pie so this is a good substitute. The pumpkin flavor is not overpowering and it mixes together well with the cheesecake part. I’ve been making it for a couple years now just as the recipe calls for. If people are looking for a stronger pumpkin flavor I would scroll through the reviews and find the tweets that use pumpkin pie filling instead of the purée.
Been making this yearly for over a decade. Love this recipe
I made this today and the only change was making the crust with crushed Nilla wafers and I will definitely give it 5 stars. Absolutely great recipe that I will make again and again. Pikka

I made this last Thanksgiving, and cheesecake is much easier than people think. I've made it many times. People are always in awe when I say I made a cheesecake. Twice, I even cooked a pumpkin & used it for the filling. It came out a little softer than I hopes, but it was a huge hit, and everyone loved it. It's my favorite recipe!
My family loved the pumpkin cheesecake. I will be making pumpkin cheesecake for Thanksgiving.

I first made this for my husband's birthday two years ago and he loved it so much that I make it every year for his birthday. He can't have much sugar so I sub it here for stevia packets, each packet replaces 2 tsp of sugar. We don't like super sweet so 8 packets are enough. Also, I used a couple good shakes of pumpkin pie spice in place of the separate spices. I used neufchatel cheese instead of cream cheese to reduce the fat. Remember to leave it out to reach room temperature because I didn't recently and the mixture was not pourable. Next time I might try whipped cream cheese or whip the cream cheese longer because I prefer a not-so-dense cheesecake.

This recipe was easy to make and tasted great! I used a springform pan and made a graham cracker crust as per another recipe on allrecipes. I doubled the amount of pumpkin in the the pumpkin layer, as I found it didn't come through enough in the original recipe.

This is insanely good! The only change I made, which may not even count as a change, was to make the graham cracker crust from a recipe here on Allrecipes but without baking it first. Only problem is, I want to eat the whole thing myself!
I made a ginger snap crust love pumpkin and ginger for my size pan I think I should have increased the bottom layer I also added a little more purée than asked for and a half cup of sour cream
First time making this double layer it is even better then just the original I make
Make it every year in the fall for holidays it a hit ! Everyone loves it I even added my own twist to it ..

I love this recipe, simple and tastes delicious as is with no altering, my family loves it and when I go to family gatherings on holidays this is what they ask for me to bring, bringing one for Easter!
I only maybe added an extra crumbled graham cracker to make the crust a tiny bit thicker--this recipe was everyone's favorite that I served it to!!!!!

I made it twice! Once for Christmas and once again a week later (…I just HAD to use the rest of the pumpkin purée before it went bad ;) …It was such a success the first time, I felt obligated to make it again. I used a graham cracker crust the first time and I made a homemade crust out of animal crackers the second time. Honestly, it would be delicious off the floor!! I highly recommend this recipe. So does everyone else that ate it. This is my new go-to.
I have been making this every Thanksgiving and Christmas for the past couple years and everyone loves it!! ?
Amazing and everyone loved it! I will make it every year for Thanksgiving!
The family enjoyed it and a new menu item for Thanksgiving meal!
I made this for Thankgiving and it came out amazing, everyone loved it! I added sour cream to the recipe (as I do for all of my cheesecake recipes) to give it that extra zing and it was delicious ??

This recipe is the best!!!! It’s perfect cheesecake with no water bath! It does not crack! I can’t believe I wasted time with a dumb springform pan water bath that inevitably leaked. I added this to my recipe book to make every year. Add salted caramel sauce on top!!! Also, I double the cinnamon, add 1 tsp ginger, and 1 tsp almond extract. I make a ginger snap crust, too. So amazing.
This would not set. Raised the temperature to 350; baked it for over 50 minutes; still goo. Triple checked and followed the recipe exactly.

I made this pie, I substituted the 1/2 cup of pumpkin purée for 1 cup instead to get more flavor of pumpkin. Also, I swapped 1/2 cup of sugar for 1/3, so the sweetness doesn’t drown out the flavor. The baking time did take longer than the recipe called for so cooked it for 50-60 minutes. I drizzled it was agave syrup and topped it with sliced almonds. It was delicious!!!
Incredible. And incredibly easy. Only change, did not use frozen whipped topping. Used real whipped cream.
I didn't bother with the layers and did as cupcakes. Delish!

It tastes like plain cream cheese on a graham crust. I bough the graham crust and it tastes great. The filling literally tastes like I took a spoon and ate straight out of the cream cheese chunk wrapped in foil. Which would be fine if I wanted to just eat a chuck of cream cheese. I can hardly taste the pumpkin at all. So grab some cinnamon grahams and a spoon. Use them to dip cream cheese straight out of the foil and there you have it. Way cheaper and tastes the same.
Delicious recipe - I substituted fresh roasted pumpkin and it worked perfectly.
it was amazing
Loved it! Family devoured it.
Tonies birhday cake 2021!!
I thought this might be perfect for the family that loves cheesecake, but isn't fond of pumpkin pie....wrong. It was ok, not going to make it again.

This Pie was so fun and delish and so easy to make .
I licked the spoons so many times, I had a sink full of spoons before I got the Cheesecake finished. 
It's a WOW cheesecake for sure! And did it make the grade in our house.....Ya Bet Cha!! It's a keeper!!

I have been making this double layered pumpkin cheesecake for at least the last 5 or 6 Thanksgivings. Even my husband, who isn’t a huge cheesecake person, really likes this one. It is requested every year and doesn’t last long. I wouldn’t change a thing.
Great flavor and texture!! Has anyone tried subbing the pumpkin out for some other fruit or chocolate? That would be a cool way to add variety!
Four stars for how EASY this is. It’s yummy but not a show stopper desert.
Used ores crust instead of graham cracker. This pie was so delicious I completely forgot to serve the whipped cream on top. It didn’t need it.

I love this simple pumkin cheese pie! It doesn't take long to whip up. Let it chill for at least 3 hours, and then dig in! My family asks for thos pie all year long! The good thing for me is that I am getting a cheese pie that doesn't require all the crazy work a cheese cake or pie requires. AND...IT IS SOOOOOOOO GOOOOD!!!
Love this, made this last year for Christmas, family loved it!

Wonderful! I think it could use slightly more spices and pumpkin, but the texture is so good just as is. Mild, creamy, and not too sweet. The pumpkin flavor is barely noticeable (which, honestly, is a win in my book! Haha), but I definitely think it could use a little more cinnamon and cloves.
I'll definitely be coming back to this recipe year after year.
Made this for Turkey Day, wonderful yummy-ness. For family with diet preferences we did non-dairy cream cheese and a GF crust and still was a hit with everyone.
Absolutely delicious. Will never go back to straight pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving again.? My husband couldn’t believe how “fancy” I got with the layers. Not telling him how easy it actually was.?
Creamy and delicious. Followed exact recipe. Would make again.

I have made this a few times, but most recently I made it for friend's family celebration (I dropped the cake off and left due to the pandemic). They messaged me afterward and said it was the best cheesecake they have ever had. One of them said they don't normally like pumpkin, but said she has been craving it ever since she tried it!

I followed the recipe exactly, except I did not use Cool Whip. I made my own real whip cream to put on top. Yum!

This is my go to every year for the holidays! I do doctor it a bit! Instead of plain pumpkin purée I use the pumpkin pie purée. I still put in the pinch of Cloves and Nutmeg. I double the amount of cinnamon and add a pinch of Allspice! I get a ton of complements on this pie!
absolutely the best pie ever! I will be making 4 for Christmas and delivering them!
Really good!

Loved this recipe! It was a hit for the whole family and was super easy to make. I used a pre-made gluten-free pie crust and lactose-free cream cheese. I accidentally added a lot more than a pinch of nutmeg, but I sure couldn't tell when I tasted it. If you love spices, you might want to increase the amount of spices, but it also tastes amazing just the way it is. I will definitely make this recipe again!

I love this recipe and have been making it for almost 7 years now. The changes that I've made to it are: doubling the recipe so I can use a whole can of pumpkin, instead of a regular graham cracker crust, I use 2 pre-made chocolate graham cracker crusts (this goes so well together, I'll never use a regular graham cracker crust with this recipe again!), adding extra vanilla, extra spices, and pumpkin pie spice as well. I add the spices to the cream cheese before dividing it for the two layers so each layer has some spices in it. I also substitute monk fruit sugar which tastes just like real sugar and even bakes the same, just zero calories. So good!
I made this for thanksgiving and it was a hit! I followed the recipe as it says. I’ll have to make 2 next year as there wasn’t any left for a midnight snack ??
It took an hour to bake, but it was well worth the wait.

This recipe is incredible! I made it for the first time and followed the recipe exactly. Very smooth consistency with just the right amount of sweet. I needed to bake it for about 60 minutes before it set properly, but that’s common with my oven. My first cheesecake was a huge hit on Thanksgiving and I will definitely make this again. Thanks!!

Followed the recipe to the T. The clove was over powering, need to tone it down a few notches. A pinch is too much believe it or not, steals the show. It seemed like it set pretty well but when I went to serve it, it wasn’t very solid under the skin even after being chilled for 2 days. I would’ve liked it to be more solid rather than semisolid. A cold can of frosting has more density.
I used an Oreo crust because why not? Lol. It looks really good and it was super simple. I can’t wait to try it.

When I made it first time, I followed the exact recipe and it came out great. The last time I made it, I increased a portion to 12 servings from 8 servings. For some reasons, the cheesecake didn’t come out right and it wasn’t sweet enough. Although I increased the recipe in the exactly the same ratio. The next time I will add more sugar but I will mix everything except eggs and check taste before baking.
I addedd 1 1/2 oz Fireball Whiskey to the pumpkin mix. Taste test was a hit with the wife (not knowing about the whiskey)!
This is perfect! I used a gluten free crust. I appreciate all the comments and reviews!
Became a new tradition! Tastes wonderful. The trick to the layer is not to over soften the cream cheese
Delicious!
It came out great ,
I'm not very experienced with baking, but this came out FANTASTIC
It's a great cheesecake! The only thing I would recommend is that to double the recipe. I like a nice tall cheesevake and the recipe as is only makes about an inch high cake.

Wow, was this good. Trying it out as a change up for the pie. Did a trial run, haven't had good luck baking things. Recipe was easy to follow. For Thanksgiving I was going to make some changes that I've seen in the reviews. The whole family loved it, even the 2yr old. Will be telling my family about this one.
Perfect recipe I make it every year now for Thanksgiving!
easy and amazing!
Increased the pumpkin, cream cheese and spices and added some sour cream!
I made it and took it to our friend’s house. They all liked it. It is a good change from pumpkin pie.
Very delish.......

Delicious! This was a huge hit with my guests! I would recommend doubling the spices if you like it a bit more flavorful, as I do. I also mixed the pumpkin mixture with just one cup of the cheesecake mixture- this gave a thicker base layer.

This was a perfect recipe. Easy to blend all the ingredients, takes very little time. I have skipped the cloves and whipped cream both times I made the recipe ( I didn't have cloves on hand and the cheesecake is sweet enough without the whipped cream). After adding the 1/2 cup pumpkin and mixing it in, I will toss in a few small spoonfulls of pumpkin and it is amazing!
It is so creamy, just rich enough and is the perfect fall flavor. Highly recommend waiting for this beaut overnight- worth the wait!
Easy and delicious. Made my own graham cracker crust

Super creamy and delicious. I added about a quarter cup more of pumpkin and it really added to the flavour. This resulted in more batter than would fit in the pan so I cooked it in an oven safe bowl and its great on its own without the crust.
Enjoyed making this recipe very easy and lots of taste. I will be making it again

I should’ve read comments first about increasing the amount of sugar! This was not sweet enough for me and I don’t have a sweet tooth the regular cheesecake layer tasted fine but the pumpkin layer had an overwhelming amount of pumpkin that the sweetness was lost. I recommend adding more sugar to combat that! The crust was good but the pumpkin layer isn’t nearly as orange as the photos and the texture wasn’t very cheesecake-y.
Delicious as written. It’s pretty quick but tastes complex and just yummy. Thanks

I am so sad to know that a desert so simple to make and DELICIOUS exists. I see myself making it a few times over the next few months. And I see myself gaining some pounds. 

This is perfection.
I followed the recipe, smooth and creamy, easy to make and superbly flavorful!
Very dence pie but awesome.
So easy! Yummy dessert (& not heavy)
all i can say is yummy!!

This was very rich and delicious! The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because I used the suggestions of another reviewer and not the exact recipe. I used 8 oz. of pumpkin purée, but the next time I think I’ll just stick with the half cup. Adding the sour cream was a great idea. Topped with caramel and toffee bits it tasted amazing!

Best Pumpkin Cheesecake ever, my
whole family loved it
Amazing!

I got a lot of compliments from this recipe! I bought my own pumpkin and made the purée myself. I swirled it instead of layering it. I also added a bit more sugar because I like my cheesecake sweeter. But definitely a great recipe!!!

It’s become a staple at our Thanksgivings. I made it one year and family had always asked for me to make it over and over again. So beyond easy but still super impressive, no one has to know:) also great for those who don’t necessarily love a classic pumpkin pie but a more subtle pumpkin flavour.
I’ve changed some of the ingredients to make it healthier and it’s amazing. I can’t wait to make it this year
This is so good and easy. I have changed the pumpkin to a fruit. I liked it that way but not as well. Making it for the holidays was a great hit.
Very easy and comes together quickly. Perfect for the first snow of the season!

I have made this for my family and my work people. It was creamy with a crunch from crust. The taste of pumpkin to cream cheese was perfect! Better than just pumpkin pie and better than just cheesecake!

This was excellent! I too used a can of Libby’s instead of the Puree but I still used the spices and everyone loved it. I didn’t have graham crackers so I did a regular pie crust and it was great. Added a bit more sugar which I would recommend. Thanks for the recipe!
made this for friends and everyone loved it! I plan to make this again for Thanksgiving
